meanings.definition: Obtain (something) by devious or cunning methods.

meanings.sent2: She wangles a better deal by sweet-talking the salesperson.
meanings.sent3: The clever cat wangles a way to open the treat jar when no one is looking.
meanings.sent4: The sly fox wangles the key to the henhouse and sneaks in under cover of darkness.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous child wangles a toy from the top shelf using a clever trick.

meanings.definition: Arrange or manipulate (a situation) to one's advantage.
meanings.sent1: They wangles the seating plan so they could sit next to their crush.
meanings.sent2: He wangles his schedule to have Fridays off every week.
meanings.sent3: She wangles a surprise party for her best friend without anyone finding out.

meanings.sent5: The student wangles a study group to help prepare for the exam.
